gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Transforms
Class CoordTransform

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Transforms.CoordTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CoordTransform
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class CoordTransform represents a separable transformation from a rectangular source region to a rectangular destination region. The rectangular regions are aligned with the coordinate axes. Currently, the only transformation type supported is linear in x and linear in y. This could be extended to deal with other commonly used transforms such as linear-log, log-linear or log-log.

See Also:

Method Detail

setPreserveAspectRatio

public void setPreserveAspectRatio(boolean flag)
Set a flag to determine whether or not future calls to setSource will adjust the specified source rectangle to have the same aspect ratio as the current destination rectangle.

Parameters:
flag - If true, subsequent calls to setSource() will adjust the aspect ratio of the source region to the aspect ratio of the destination region. In this case, the destination region MUST be set to meaningful values before setting the source region. If false, the region passed to setSource() will be used without modification.

equals

public boolean equals(CoordTransform tran)
Check whether or not the current transform maps between the same regions as the specified transform.

Parameters:
tran - The transform object to compare with the current transform object.
Returns:
Returns true if the current transform object maps between exactly the same regions as the specified transform object.

setSource

public void setSource(CoordBounds b)
The the source region that will be mapped to the destination region. If the preserve aspect ratio flag has been set, the specified bounds will be adjusted to match the aspect ratio of the destination region. The destination region MUST be set first, in this case.

Parameters:
b - The bounds to use for the source region.

setSource

public void setSource(float x1,
                      float y1,
                      float x2,
                      float y2)
The the source region that will be mapped to the destination region. If the preserve aspect ratio flag has been set, the specified region will be adjusted to match the aspect ratio of the destination region. The destination region MUST be set first, in this case.

Parameters:
x1 - The left edge of the region.
y1 - The lower edge of the region.
x2 - The right edge of the region.
y2 - The upper edge of the region.

setDestination

public void setDestination(CoordBounds b)
The the Destination region that the source region will be mapped to. If the preserve aspect ratio flag has been set, setDestination MUST be called before calling setSource().

Parameters:
b - The bounds to use for the destination region.

setDestination

public void setDestination(float x1,
                           float y1,
                           float x2,
                           float y2)
The the Destination region that the source region will be mapped to. If the preserve aspect ratio flag has been set, setDestination MUST be called before calling setSource().

Parameters:
x1 - The left edge of the region.
y1 - The lower edge of the region.
x2 - The right edge of the region.
y2 - The upper edge of the region.
